resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

thisisnic commented on a change in pull request #11482:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11482#discussion_r751419570



##########
File path: r/R/duckdb.R
##########
@@ -55,7 +55,7 @@
 to_duckdb <- function(.data,
                       con = arrow_duck_connection(),
                       table_name = unique_arrow_tablename(),
-                      auto_disconnect = FALSE) {
+                      auto_disconnect = TRUE) {
   .data <- as_adq(.data)
   duckdb::duckdb_register_arrow(con, table_name, .data)
 

Review comment:
       Comment on line 70:
   > # we should probably confirm that this use of src$disco is kosher.
   
   Is this now confirmed?

##########
File path: r/R/duckdb.R
##########
@@ -55,7 +55,7 @@
 to_duckdb <- function(.data,
                       con = arrow_duck_connection(),
                       table_name = unique_arrow_tablename(),
-                      auto_disconnect = FALSE) {
+                      auto_disconnect = TRUE) {
   .data <- as_adq(.data)
   duckdb::duckdb_register_arrow(con, table_name, .data)
 

Review comment:
       Comment on line 70:
   > we should probably confirm that this use of src$disco is kosher.
   
   Is this now confirmed?

jonkeane commented on a change in pull request #11482:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11482#discussion_r751431199



##########
File path: r/R/duckdb.R
##########
@@ -55,7 +55,7 @@
 to_duckdb <- function(.data,
                       con = arrow_duck_connection(),
                       table_name = unique_arrow_tablename(),
-                      auto_disconnect = FALSE) {
+                      auto_disconnect = TRUE) {
   .data <- as_adq(.data)
   duckdb::duckdb_register_arrow(con, table_name, .data)
 

Review comment:
       There hasn't been any comments (positive or negative) on https://github.com/tidyverse/dbplyr/issues/681 
   
   On the positive side: this is "just" an element of a lis that stores an object and we are relying on the way R cleans up objects when they are GCed, we could name it anything and so long as d(b)plyr doesn't collide with that name for something else it should _just work_ whether or not we are supposed to extend `tbl$src$disco`
   




--

jonkeane commented on a change in pull request #11482:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11482#discussion_r751431199



##########
File path: r/R/duckdb.R
##########
@@ -55,7 +55,7 @@
 to_duckdb <- function(.data,
                       con = arrow_duck_connection(),
                       table_name = unique_arrow_tablename(),
-                      auto_disconnect = FALSE) {
+                      auto_disconnect = TRUE) {
   .data <- as_adq(.data)
   duckdb::duckdb_register_arrow(con, table_name, .data)
 

Review comment:
       There hasn't been any comments (positive or negative) on https://github.com/tidyverse/dbplyr/issues/681 
   
   On the positive side: this is "just" an element of a list that stores an object and we are relying on the way R cleans up objects when they are GCed, we could name it anything and so long as d(b)plyr doesn't collide with that name for something else it should _just work_ whether or not we are supposed to extend `tbl$src$disco`
   




--

paleolimbot commented on a change in pull request #11482:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11482#discussion_r751533545



##########
File path: r/R/duckdb.R
##########
@@ -55,7 +55,7 @@
 to_duckdb <- function(.data,
                       con = arrow_duck_connection(),
                       table_name = unique_arrow_tablename(),
-                      auto_disconnect = FALSE) {
+                      auto_disconnect = TRUE) {
   .data <- as_adq(.data)
   duckdb::duckdb_register_arrow(con, table_name, .data)
 

Review comment:
       Unless I'm missing something, you could give it a more meaningful name (like `$src$.arrow_finalizer_environment`)?




-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

jonkeane commented on a change in pull request #11482:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11482#discussion_r751541723



##########
File path: r/R/duckdb.R
##########
@@ -55,7 +55,7 @@
 to_duckdb <- function(.data,
                       con = arrow_duck_connection(),
                       table_name = unique_arrow_tablename(),
-                      auto_disconnect = FALSE) {
+                      auto_disconnect = TRUE) {
   .data <- as_adq(.data)
   duckdb::duckdb_register_arrow(con, table_name, .data)
 

Review comment:
       _nods_ yes, totally could. I kept it in the "traditional" spot since that's what dbplyr does, but maybe it would be better to proactively avoid any possible collisions/changes in their API for that.
   
   NGL, `disco` is a hilariously awesome name even if it isn't _super_ transparent 🕺 




--

fields.description: Now that https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb/pull/2408 is done, we can re-enable this (when duckdb goes to cran next).
